## 10-Year Treasury Yield Rises in November

The 10-year Treasury yield rose to 4.13% in November, up 7 basis points from October's 4.06% low. Yields have been rising as markets reassess inflation expectations and Federal Reserve policy implications.

{{chart:10-yr Treasury Yield}}

**Context:** The 10-year Treasury yield serves as a benchmark for mortgage rates and broader borrowing costs across the economy. Rising yields can increase borrowing costs for consumers and businesses.
